title: Jonas Salk
subtle:
Biography (nonfiction), 1,745 words, Level Y (Grade 5), Lexile 1030L            
                        
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     Z1 and Z2
description: The spring and summer of 1953 was terrifying for parents in the United States. They braced themselves for the possibility of polio. Through his determination and unorthodox thinking, Jonas Salk developed a polio vaccine and children's lives were saved. Jonas Salk provides students an in-depth look into both Dr. Salk's life and his search for the vaccine. The book can also be used to teach students the elements of a biography and the proper use of hyphenated compound adjectives. The book and lesson are also available for levels Z1 and Z2.
